applicableFor.title: Who do the Terms & Conditions apply to?
applicableFor.content: For all registered users of the app.

registration.title: Registration
registration.content: Via email provider. Indicating the educational field is optional and used for module personalization.

usageRights.title: Usage Rights
usageRights.content:
Private modules are only visible to the user.
Public modules can be copied.

prohibitedUsage.title: Prohibited Usage
prohibitedUsage.content: No reverse engineering, automated creation, or copying of UI elements.

costs.title: Costs
costs.content: The app is generally free. There are optional in-app purchases (chips).

payments.title: Payments
payments.content: Payment via Google Pay and Apple Pay. Chips can be exchanged for energy.

cancellation.title: Cancellation
cancellation.content: No refund for already consumed energy. No subscription model in use.

latePayment.title: Late Payment
latePayment.content: In case of payment issues, the account may be suspended until resolved.

provision.title: Provision
provision.content: No guaranteed minimum availability. The goal, however, is permanent availability.

support.title: Support & Updates
support.content: Support via email or contact form. Regular updates are planned.

liability.title: Liability
liability.content: No liability for data loss or app crashes. Export function for data backup is available.

collectedData.title: Collected Data
collectedData.content: Registration data, learning behavior, used features, last login, country of origin, language, etc.

purpose.title: Purpose of Use
purpose.content: Personalization, functionality assurance, and further development of the platform.

userRights.title: User Rights
userRights.content: Account deletion possible. Data export available.

applicableLaw.title: Applicable Law
applicableLaw.content: German law applies. Place of jurisdiction is the company‚Äôs registered office.

termsChanges.title: Changes to Terms & Conditions
termsChanges.content: Changes will be announced via app or email.

severability.title: Severability Clause
severability.content: If individual provisions are invalid, the remainder of the Terms & Conditions remains valid.

legalLanguage.title: Legally Binding Language
legalLanguage.content: In case of doubt, the German version applies.

languageNotifications.title: Language Notifications
languageNotifications.content: Changes to the Terms & Conditions will be displayed in all supported app languages.

communityFeatures.title: Community Features
communityFeatures.content: Modules can be copied, created, and reported.

aiFeatures.title: AI Features
aiFeatures.content: AI is used when the user explicitly selects it (e.g., 'Create with AI').

deleteAccount.title: Delete Account
deleteAccount.message: Do you really want to delete your account? All your data will be lost and cannot be recovered.

data.title: All Questions
data.areYousureDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this module?
data.youNeedQuestionsToStartAQuiz: You need at least one question to start a quiz.

prompts.instruction: Create between 3 and 10 questions based on the following topics: {{text}}.
prompts.instruction_convert: You will receive questions from user input. Convert these questions into the desired format, trying to stay as close as possible to the original question: {{text}}.
prompts.instruction_text:
Create between 3 and 10 questions based on the information provided in the following text: {{text}}.

These questions should cover all important aspects of the text.
prompts.standaloneRule: Each question must stand alone and must not depend on the context of other questions or any external text. The user should be able to answer the questions independently without needing context from other questions or materials not included in the question.
prompts.important: IMPORTANT: Do not include questions that rely on external materials or texts not contained within the question!
prompts.outputFormat: The output must be a valid, parseable JSON array of objects.
prompts.questionStructure: Each question must have the following structure (please follow exactly):
prompts.structureExample:
{
  "question": "The question as a string.",
  "hint": "",          // If the question requires a hint, otherwise leave empty
  "explanation": "",   // If the question requires an explanation, otherwise leave empty
  "answers": ["", ...],
  "answerIndex": [X]     // one or more correct answers; index based on position in the answers array (starting at 0)
}
prompts.rules:
- The number of answer options must always be {{numberOfAnswers}}, no more, no less.
- {{questionTypeDescription}}
- The number of correct answers (answerIndex) must be at least 1.
- The index of the correct answer should be randomized and not always 0.
- Each answer option must be a valid, stringified JSON string.
- Do not provide any additional explanation or introduction outside the JSON ‚Äì only return the JSON.
prompts.rules_convert:
- The number of answer options must always be {{numberOfAnswers}}, no more, no less.
- {{questionTypeDescription}}
- If the user has provided answers, adhere to the number of provided answers regardless of {{numberOfAnswers}}.
- The number of correct answers (answerIndex) must be at least 1.
- Each answer option must be a valid, stringified JSON string.
- Do not provide any additional explanation or introduction outside the JSON ‚Äì only return the JSON.
prompts.rules_text:
- The number of answer options must always be {{numberOfAnswers}}, no more, no less.
- {{questionTypeDescription}}
- The number of correct answers (answerIndex) must be at least 1.
- The index of the correct answer should be randomized and not always 0.
- Each answer option must be a valid, stringified JSON string.
- Do not provide any additional explanation or introduction outside the JSON ‚Äì only return the JSON.
prompts.multipleChoiceDescription: This is a multiple-choice question, multiple answers may be correct.
prompts.singleChoiceDescription: This is a single-choice question, only one answer is correct.
prompts.openQuestionDescription: This is an open-ended question where the user must first provide an answer, which will then be checked against the correct answer. Only one correct answer exists.
